name: Hotel Juliani

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Hotel Juliani for 6 nights from 06 July. We found the hotel to be very clean with friendly staff prepared to help with advice on any issue. The outlook from the front of the hotel over Spinola Bay toward Saint Julians is magnificent. There are many restaurants in the immediate location with a variety of cuisines to satisfy all. In addition the hotel has a very fine restaurant of it's own called Zest with a very good asian selection to go with western style meals on the menu. In addition the hotel is right alongside a bus stop to take you to Sliema and Valletta in one direction or to Bugibba in the opposite.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: We would recommend this hotel to all for a pleasant stay in Malta.
reviews.title: Great hotel with fantastic views + pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in hotel juliani for a few days in mid August. We stayed in room 701 which has fantastic views of the little harbour and the sea. There are any bars and restaurants in st juliani but the room was quiet. The rooftop pool is very nice and wasnt very busy. The rooms decor is pretty cool and fresh design, great for a seaside hotel. We had a minor problem with the AC but it was fixed the next day we indicated to staff and we were offered another room for that night. Great service. Breakfast isn't included in the room price. The restaurant Zest (located on the first floor ) was good but maybe a bit overpriced. Overall this hotel is great if you want to discover Malta and relax.
reviews.title: Stylish and chic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed for a week in August and the Hotel in Spinola Bay is excellent for exploring the island. Hotel is stylish and chic and service is warm and friendly. Rooms are a good size with all your needs catered for. If you want a view of the bay, you will have to pay extra, but worth it. Restaurant in hotel "Zest" is a lovely dining experience and value for money. Overall can only recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Almost perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My friend and I were staying at this place over the long week-end 9-13 Aug. Room: junior suite.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Small, modern, elegant, lovely interior design, excellent location, great sea view, nice breakfast buffet....lovely experience.
reviews.title: Modern chic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have now stayed at Hotel Juliani twice, and it gets better and better. The staff and the facilities are perfectly matched to a relaxed, yet elegantly luxurious visit. I couldn't recommend it highly enough - make sure you stay in a room with a sea view, as Spinola Bay is spell-binding at any hour of the day.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel - couldn't ask for more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Malta for a family event, and so had booked a large number of rooms at the Juliani for 4-5 days. The general manager and all his staff couldn't not have been more accommodating to the varied needs of all the group, whether they were parents with very young children, or those who liked to go out late, and come home even later.
reviews.title: Look No Further

likes.liked: — size of the room, it's view, and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And it does have some of the best coffee on the island!.
reviews.title: Perfect, I plan on going back!

likes.liked: — Proximity with everything and Hotel Staff professionalism
likes.disliked: — To say something, the mattress but not a big concern!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you’re going to Malta and looking for a place to stay that is a beautiful hotel, great location with gorgeous views, excellent service, rooftop pool, large hearty breakfasts with freshly squeezed OJ, and all at a value, then Hotel Juliani is the place for you!
reviews.title: Faultless hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had spent hours reading all the reviews for hotels in Malta trying to ascertain the perfect place to stay. In the end, we decided to take a punt on the Hotel Juliani. From all that had been written, we knew it would be 'ok' for a week.
reviews.title: Exceeds Expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived at the beginning of September, stayed seven nights and from the moment we parked right through to our departure, we were not disappointed in any way. The team of staff are super-friendly and go out of there way to make your stay pleasant. The facilities are excellent for a boutique hotel in the centre of a town. We had a basic room with no view...but it was lovely, huge, modern, clean, well-lit, plenty of mirrors, sufficient wardrobe space, good shower, large tv, plus a well-stocked and reasonably priced minibar! Then there's the wonderful rooftop pool with excellent views of the bay that is perfect for a dip to cool down inbetween catching rays on a lounger. The food is superb, from the breakfasts through to Zest restaurant, good value for money, great tasting and excellent service.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, the location is excellent! Having travelled extensively around the island by car whilst there, we couldn't find a better town to be in...St Julians is welcoming with plenty of good restaurants and bars conveniently located and good bus links to all the main hubs.
reviews.title: Large room, spectacular view of Spinola bay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in August for 4 nights and were returning after staying last year. This year we had 2 ambassador suites and they were fantastic, similar to the junior seaview but a bit bigger. This year seemed a bit busier especially around the pool but we still managed to find a lounger when needed. Another great stay.
reviews.title: Great location, but disappointingly small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dee G should have moved to a junior suite. Large room and spectacular view which we never got tired of from our balcony overlooking Spinola Bay. The hotel restaurant, Zest was excellent in every way and we loved the rooftop pool on the ninth floor. The area is so convenient for good restaurants and bars, walks along the huge promenade (miles of it). Open top bus tours stop right across the road and the X2 to and from the airport (2.60 from memory for a day ticket) also stops right outside. No traffic noise inside the room whatsoever when double glazed balcony doors closed.
reviews.title: Had high expectations of s rooftop meal here but poor show

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very nice hotel and certainly above most of what St Julian's has to offer (as far as we could tell). The room (junior suite) was very large and had a fabulous view over Spinola Bay complete with balcony on which to sit and watch the world go by. The staff were very friendly and everything very clean and well ordered. On the roof, the pool is small (and suprisingly cold) but has even better views and is perfect for whiling away the day. Ate in Zest once and was pleasantly surprised by the quality (though quite pricey) - didn't try the rooftop restaurant.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, just not sure about Malta

likes.liked: — Location, cleaniliness, friendliness of staff, decor, restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can catch pretty much any bus from right outside the door - including the open-top sightseeing tour. We had a couple of timeshare touts hanging around on the odd day, but once you've made it absolutely clear you're not interested then they tend to steer clear of you. Nowhere near as bad as in Bugibba or Qawra.
reviews.title: Good hotel but possibly style over substance?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: For those of you worried about the proximity to Paceville (the 'Tenerife-like' bar district), then don't. Hotel Juliani is far enough away to avoid the hoards of p*ssed teenagers and yet you pick up some of the buzz from people wandering down to the seafront restaurants just outside.
reviews.title: An aaming place

likes.liked: — Clean, modern, spacious, friendly staff and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: All in all - very much recommended hotel, but am not entirely sure about Malta as a destination. A lack of beaches (unless you go over to Gozo), generally arid landscape and perhaps a tad too many Brits mean a week is definitely enough. Highly recommend Valletta and Mdina for a day each.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a very enjoyable short break here and were lucky enough to arrive during the St Julians Fiesta which was a great experience.
reviews.title: A great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely hotel, as everyone has stated in previous reviews.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool area well maintained and always clean towels.
reviews.title: One year later, it's still great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was surprised not to have tea and coffe facilities in room, unusual for a hotel and the cost charged.
reviews.title: Lovely Chic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely decoration and a fantastic view of the harbour from the room.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Couldn't fault anything, well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Possibly the best hotel on the Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Beautifully decorated and cleverly designed to make spaces with little natural light feel calm and relaxing. 1st room felt claustrophobic - I initially thought it had not got a window but because it was a double and not a twin as requested we were changed the following day and although 2nd room overlooked the street at the back it had a wide window and a little balcony. The change was made with efficiency and courtesy. Breakfast was lovely especially the bread and cakes made on the premises. Rooftop pool is very cute and has lovely views and plenty of space for everyone. Lovely little touches like the free cold drinks. Staff were a delight especially Kenny and I loved the singing cleaner. Zest the restaurant attached to the hotel is a treat not to be missed - lovely fusion food and superb service. Location is perfect - although I was initially shocked to see a McDonalds next door. It is in a very busy street overlooking the bay but inside is an oasis of calm. Really loved this hotel - would definitely return.
reviews.title: We fell in love with this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fantastic hotel. The bedrooms were immaculate and cleaned to a high standard on a daily basis. The buffet at breaskfast had plenty of choice and staff were courteous and friendly at all times. The location in St Julian's was perfect for sightseeing and the bus stop was just outside the hotel. A lot of people have said that the pool area was too small but it was perfect for the size of the hotel (44 rooms). There is plenty to see in Malta & Gozo and St Juliani is the perfect hotel for the duration of your stay. I can definitely recommend this hotel and if I was lucky enough to go back to Malta this would be the hotel I would be booking!
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wfe and i stayed in this hotel for 7 nights from end of august to 4 September.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Our experience was ery positive from check in to departure. The room wa very clean, comfortable and spacious. Room facilities included gowns and up market toiletries. the roof top pool area was small but more than adequate and pool towels were available. this hotel does not have a restaurant for evening meals but there are numerious restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great service, rooms and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good with freshly squeezed orange juice, and a large hot and cold buffet. the hotel is a boutique hotel and only has 44 bedrooms.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at Hotel Juliani and found it to be one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at for comfort, location, VIEWS!! and service. Our room was on the eighth floor with the most amazing views and was extremely comfortable. Prior to this we had stayed all over Italy and Greece, so we know whereof we speak (the bed was fantastic). Probably my only negative criticism would be the pillows (bit too hard) but I was told by the Manager that they will be offering a Pillow Menu in the near future! The service of the staff was fantastic, be it at Reception, the cleaning crew and particularly the staff at Breakfast. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of going to Malta.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Hotel Juliani is fantastic!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!

likes.disliked: — Intermittent Wireless Connection in My Room...wireless is excellent in the lobby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in process was quick and painless!! The room is nicely decorated. The bed was very comfortable. There were plenty of electrical outlets. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The location is central to places of activities and restaurants. Many kudos to this establishment. I would highly recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Heaven

likes.liked: — Views, Room comfort and cleanliness, friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 10 days in Hotel Juliani for our honeymoon and absolutely loved it. Malta had been recommended to us by lots of friends so we decided it would be a good place to honeymoon and we weren't disappointed.
reviews.title: Great location and fantastic dining options

likes.liked: — the modern style of the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd recommend getting one of the junior suites with a view of the mesmerising Spinoloa Bay if you decide to stay the Juliani. The view is magnificent and although the road is busy with traffic and people, the glass patio door is soundproofed so we weren't particularly disturbed - well apart from at 8am on one day when a load of buses (which were on strike for four days) drove around St Julians blasting their horns!
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Great Location, Lovely Hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here twice, mainly cause it is the best in its price range on offer. Hotels in Malta seem to come in two categories: cheap or expensive, and you get what you pay for. Juliani was the middle ground.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a good location.

likes.disliked: — Swimming pool is very small and the sun bathing area soon goes into the shade in the aftrenoon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Rooms are lovely and spacious, only issue was the showers that seem to go hot/cold at random. Asked front desk and they claim that the identified the problem and were in the process of fixing it.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

likes.disliked: — noisy people in room next door! walls a bit thin...

reviews.title: Fantastic location
reviews.text: But still overall, great place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a week at the hotel Juliani from the 4th May. We found the hotel to be very clean and all of the staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: cool & relaxed Juliani

description: Hotel Juliani, a 4 star Hotel, is Malta’s only small design boutique hotel, and it is enviably located in the heart of St Julian’s. In fact, you’re never more than 25 minutes away from most parts of the island, including the beautiful baroque capital of Valletta. Originally a traditional seafront townhouse, the hotel has been meticulously converted to provide 44 rooms, an intimate setting and very personalised service to its guests. Today it remains a family-run establishment, and we are committed to ensuring you feel at home and well looked after. Each hotel room offers excellent facilities, fresh Mediterranean decor and plenty of space. Many also boast unobstructed sea views, and you will be able to watch the colourful fishing boats bobbing on the water from the comfort of your balcony or the rooftop swimming pool. Meanwhile, as a cosmopolitan commercial and entertainment district, St Julian’s surrounds you with many of the best restaurants, bars and shops that Malta has to offer.
